amendment.description: To save at least $20 million annually by ending federal unemployment payments to jobless millionaires and billionaires.

vote.text: Amendment SA 281, under the order of 4/5/2011, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 100 - 0. Record Vote Number: 55.

action.text: Amendment SA 281 proposed by Senator Landrieu for Senator Coburn. (consideration: CR S2155-2157, S2168-2171, S2179-2180; text: CR S2156) To save at least $20 million annually by ending federal unemployment payments to jobless millionaires and billionaires.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 281 proposed by Senator Landrieu for Senator Coburn.

Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 281, under the order of 4/5/2011, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 100 - 0. Record Vote Number: 55.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 281, under the order of 4/5/2011, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, the amendment was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 100 - 0. Record Vote Number: 55.
